definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: They are the hieroglyphics of feudalism succeeding those of theocracy .
sentences.chinese: 这是继神权政治象形文字之后的封建制度象形文字。

sentences.english: They are the hieroglyphics of feudalism succeeding those of theocracy .
sentences.chinese: 这是继神权政治象形文字之后的封建制度象形文字。

sentences.english: Grouping is typically seen in early pictographic languages - the combined symbols representing a new concept - and the researchers suspect that prehistoric Europeans had established a similar system.
sentences.chinese: 在早期的象形文字语言中，成组聚集是经典特色。

sentences.english: Alphabetic writing in English belonging to the Chinese is hieroglyphs, ways of thinking are different.
sentences.chinese: 英文属于拼音文字而中文是象形文字，思维方式不同。

sentences.english: Some of the earliest written Chinese characters were quite pictographic.//
sentences.chinese: 一些最古老的文字属象形文字。

sentences.english: Chinese writings are pictographs. They are like pictures, very complicated.
sentences.chinese: 中文是象形文字，犹如一个图画，很复杂。

sentences.english: Mayan hieroglyphics in the Dresden Codex.
sentences.chinese: 在德累斯顿抄本玛雅象形文字。

sentences.english: Shape imitation and meaning imitation are two expressive features of pictograph.
sentences.chinese: 拟形和拟意是象形文字的两大表现特征。

sentences.english: Early writing was pictographic in nature.
sentences.chinese: 早期的书写实际上是象形文字。

sentences.english: Or I guess it is a uniform hieroglyphic.
sentences.chinese: 或者我猜它是一种统一的象形文字。

sentences.english: Generally speaking, the pictograph is the first text.
sentences.chinese: 一般而言，象形文字是最早产生的文字。

sentences.english: Initially the patterns I used were hieroglyph like symbols.
sentences.chinese: 我所采用的图案是类似符号的象形文字。

sentences.english: Do you know how to write this beautiful hieroglyph?
sentences.chinese: 你知道怎样写这个漂亮的象形文字吗？
考古学家追踪象形文字。

sentences.english: Many Chinese characters are pictographs and often the meaning of a particular character is apparent in the pictorial form of character.
sentences.chinese: 许多汉字属象形文字，我们可以从字形猜测词义。

definition: pictogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
oracle script/oracle bone character (an early form of Chinese script)
Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
pictogram/one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
rock painting/picture or writing carved on rocks
tortoise shell and animal bones used in divination/oracle bone inscriptions (an early form of Chinese script)
to create Chinese characters/cf Six Methods of forming Chinese characters 六書|六书[liu4 shu1]
